alert.note: Alert for Bolivar; Sunflower (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 11:52PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sunflower and northeastern Bolivar Counties through 1230 AM CST... At 1152 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gunnison, or 8 miles north of Rosedale, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Deeson around 1200 AM CST. Shelby around 1205 AM CST. Mound Bayou around 1210 AM CST. Parchman and Rome around 1225 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Alligator, Winstonville, Duncan and Merigold. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for north central and northwestern Mississippi.
